No Portal to jednak Portal. Pamiętam jak na od kolegi komputerze grałem w Portal 1 i wtedy bardzo mnie to wciągnęło a teraz postanowiłem kupić Portal 2 i nie żałuję. Gra ma swój klimat jak i jest kontynuacją Portal 1. Gra ma spaniałą fabułę jak i mechanikę gry. Fabuła przykrutka (udało mi się ją skończyć w 8 h) ale jest warsztat społeczności, który oferuje nowe poziomy stworzone przez społeczność. Jeśli chcesz sam możesz stworzyć swój poziom. Można grać w 2 osoby co zadowoli niektóre osoby. (Osobiście nie próbowałem.) Nie trafiłem na żaden błąd ale w niektórych poziomach potrzebowałem pomocy. Jedyny minus to jak chcę położyć portal w jakimś miejscu, ta czasem się nie kładzie.(Miałem tak z 2 razy). Polecam grę każdej osobie, która jeszcze nie grała. Gra jest tego warta.

Portal 2 is one of those games that no matter if you like puzzle games or not, you should try. That being said, this game takes Portal 1's ideas and fucking destroys them with even more clever and interesting mechanics. I always thought Portal 1 was lacking in content, and when it was starting to get good, it ended. Portal 2 has far more levels and puzzles than 1 did, and many of its new concepts destroy P1s ones. many of them are mixed to create at blend that makes every level feel unique and fun. "But what about the story?" you may ask. Well, it's great. 
*SPOILERS*
The main story starts with our main protagonist who gets put in what is essentially a jail cell for years until we meet this core who maintains the humans breaks us out. His name is wheatley, and he is with us at the beginning until something later on happens. We head into a decaying test room from the first game. we get back our portal gun and eventually, wheatley tries to reactivate the facility near GlaDOS' robotic corpse when she slowly reactivates. She "destroys" wheatley before putting you into the chambers again. So that's the beginning plot in a nutshell, but are the characters and dialogue good? Good? GOOD? They are amazing! While P1 was more satirical and passive aggressive, in P2, the characters are witty, and have more dark humor. Wheatley is a dumbass who consistently does things wrong in a way that makes you sometimes chuckle. GlaDOS also has much more personality in this game than in the first. every character is memorable and has some unique charm that makes them easily quotable. Overall, Portal 2 is still one of the best puzzle games of all time and is certainly a game I would recommend to any person who is into video games. 10/10

One of the best single player game on all platforms, and Steven Merchant voice acting Wheatly is magical.

The baking contest lasted for 6 years. 

Assuming that Grandma started making dough for cookies since day 1, that makes for 3,153,600 minutes. 

6,000,000 cookies baked during 3,153,600 minutes comes out to 1.9 cookies per minute. That means Grandma baked roughly 1 cookie every 30 seconds. 

In the main kitchen, the most famous and biggest cooking place, there are 15 ovens. According to kitchen assistants, dough would go into the pantry, sit for 15-20 minutes, then put into the oven. 

It takes 1 hour to bake a cookie using modern furnaces which operate at much higher temperatures than the traditional ovens back home. However, lets say that the ovens were operating at a level that we see today, that means it would take 1 hour, 20 minutes to prepare dough and cook 15 cookies assuming they were all burned simultaniously. (Disregarding the time it would take for the dough to sit and for it to be transported from the pantry to the oven.) The elevators used to transport dough were very slow and could only take up 7 cookies at a time with their weight capacity. However, for our greatest chefs, we're going to assume that cookies were teleported instantly from the pantry to oven. 

That means 15 cookies were made and cooked every 1.2 hours. That comes out to exactly 300 cookies every 24 hours (Assuming the making and cooking of cookies was happening every hour straight for 6 years on an uninterrupted basis) the total # of baked cookies would be 657,000 for those 6 years. The official Chefs story is that 4,000,000 cookies were made and baked at the main kitchen alone.

Level dizaynı, bulmaca çözerken ki size verilen elementlerin bolluğu, falan her şeyi ile ilk oyundan daha üst düzey bir oyun. İlk oyunda sadece portal açıp kapatabiliyordunuz, bazen kutu falan da veriliyordu size ama ana gayeniz bi kapı düğmesinin üzerine kutu koymak veya lazerle açmak ile geçiyordu. Ama bu oyunda, hız veren turuncu boyalar, zıplamanızı sağlayan mavi boyalar, üzerine portal konulamayan zeminlerin üzerinde bulunan su(galiba), yansıtıcılar falan filan. Çeşitlilik olarak güzel bir oyun.

This is genuinely one of the best games I have ever played.


PROS:

-story is really good
-test chambers rarely get repetitive
-graphics and lighting is phenomenal
-characters are extremely likable with funny and charming dialogue
-whole game has so much charm
-soundtrack is so amazing 
-the scale of your surroundings is great
-test chambers are so satisfying once you figure it out
-you can make your own test chambers as well as download others from the workshop
-amazing community and surprisingly still alive as ever



CONS:

-test chambers can get repetitive (rarely as previously stated)

One of the best games I've ever played. After finishing Portal 1 (which was also great), I thought it couldn't get any better. It did, and much more than I excpected. The graphics are great, the story even better and overall gameplay is also really nice. The humor in this game is hilarious at times, ranging from passive-aggressive comments to sarcastic jokes. I enjoyed every second of Portal 2, and was kinda sad when it was over. You won't regret buying this game.
